TopicTitle: The International Flag of Planet Earth

Articles.Content:
Some Swedish just releases a really cool project, the [International Flag of Planet Earth](http://www.flagofplanetearth.com/#intro-shift)

Unfortunantly NASA still says they will use an American flag if they get to Mars.

Another one?

How many people have designed their own "Earth Flag"? They never seem to catch on.
I don't get it, looks a lot like the flag of the olympic games.

In Short: What a silly idea.

In Detail: I think that such a concept is pretty well gratuitous. Such an idea would make sense if we were a part of a large community/group of planets, we would need something to represent our planet, but we haven't yet discovered even another planet with sentient, complex life and societies on it, so there is no need for such an invention. And if we'd ever need one, I'd say that the UN logo on a flag would be sufficient. Also, how does does a symbol comprised of a circle of circles represent Earth or remind us to "take care of each other"? I think seeing pictures and film of average people in other places around the world and their daily lives would inspire people to care more for others than a simple flag. The flag has a detailed explanation as to how it represents Earth, but shouldn't symbols on a flag that might be seen by other beings who might have a totally different conception of language than we do be self-explaining and self-evident? In addition to the UN logo (or potentially replacing the UN logo) another flag design might just be a simplified map of the world; There would be very little, if any bickering between nations about what design to use and the flag would represent Earth very literally without any sort of incredibly well-hidden or designer-formulated symbolism that might mean something totally different to somebody else.
